title: Lesson B2-3 Assessment: Ergative Case Marking

questions.question: When is Ergative case used for subjects?

options.text: For transitive verbs in Series II and III
For all verbs in Series II

questions.explanation: Ergative case is used specifically for transitive verbs (verbs with objects) in Series II (Aorist) and Series III (Perfect). Intransitive verbs keep Nominative in all series.

questions.question: What is the Ergative form of 'ბავშვი' [bavshvi] (child)?
questions.explanation: The Ergative form is ბავშვმა, formed by dropping the final -ი and adding -მა suffix.

questions.question: What is the Ergative form of 'ის' [is] (he/she)?
questions.explanation: Third person singular pronoun changes form in Ergative: ის → მან. This is a special form, not formed with -მა suffix.

questions.question: In the sentence 'მე ვირბინე' [me virbine] (I ran), should 'მე' be in Ergative case?
questions.explanation: No. 'To run' is an intransitive verb (no direct object), so the subject stays in Nominative case even in past tense. Only transitive verbs trigger Ergative marking.

questions.question: Which sentence has correct Ergative marking?
questions.explanation: Option (b) is correct. In Aorist (Series II) with a transitive verb, the subject must be Ergative (ბავშვმა). Option (a) incorrectly uses Nominative. Option (c) incorrectly uses Ergative in present tense (Series I).

questions.question: What is the Ergative form of 'ისინი' [isini] (they)?
questions.explanation: Third person plural pronoun changes form in Ergative: ისინი → მათ. Like singular მან, this is a special form.

questions.question: True or False: All verbs in Series II use Ergative case for their subjects.

options.text: False - only transitive verbs use Ergative

questions.explanation: False. Only transitive verbs (verbs with direct objects) use Ergative case for subjects in Series II/III. Intransitive verbs keep Nominative subjects in all series.

questions.question: How is Ergative case typically marked on common nouns?

options.text: By adding -მა suffix after dropping final -ი

questions.explanation: Most common nouns form Ergative by dropping the final -ი (if present) and adding the -მა suffix. Example: ბავშვი → ბავშვმა.
